name: The Unnamed Lake
description: Still waters lap at the edges of flooded grasslands. The lake should not be here — its birth was sudden, and its silence is unnatural. Beneath the surface, ruined stone and flickering shapes hint at deeper truths.

story_actions.story_text: Speak with a farmer standing at the edge of the flood, mourning their ruined fields.
You spot the ribs of a merchant cart poking from the water. A wheel spins slowly in the current. No bones — just broken crates, and a single sealed box.
You wade through shallow water and find the tops of fence posts, a stone wall, and the faint lines of old furrows. This was farmland. Until recently.
A woman from Hillstead squints at the lake. 'If that valve works, open it. My brother’s crew was trapped at the quarry when the road went under.'
An older man crouches near the lake, wringing water from a ragged coat. 'Crossing gave out beneath me,' he mutters. 'Bridge snapped like straw. One moment dry, the next — swallowed.'
He doesn't look up. 'It wasn’t rain. It wasn’t runoff. It hit all at once — roaring, cold, like it had somewhere to be.'
He finally meets your eyes. 'This lake… I can’t prove it, but it *moved*. Came from somewhere far off. I felt it, deep in my bones. Like it left something behind to get here.'
